
# `between()` and `near()`

---
# The `happy` data frame

.center[
```{r echo = FALSE}
happy %>% 
  kbl %>% 
  kable_styling()
```
]
---
# `between()`

Choose countries that have a `ladder_score` between (and including) 4.5 and 6.2
--
.panelset[
```{r panelset = TRUE}
happy %>% 
  filter(ladder_score >= 4.5,
         ladder_score <= 6.2)
```
]
---
# `between()`

.panelset[
```{r panelset = TRUE}
happy %>% 
  filter(between(ladder_score, 4.5, 6.2))
```
]
---
# `near()`

Choose countries that have a `ladder_score` equal to 6 +/- 0.5
--
.panelset[
```{r panelset = TRUE}
happy %>% 
  filter(between(ladder_score, 5.5, 6.5))
```
]
---
# `near()`

.panelset[
```{r panelset = TRUE}
happy %>% 
  filter(near(ladder_score, 6, tol = 0.5))
```
]
---
# `near()`

Choose countries that have a `ladder_score` equal to the mean `ladder_score` +/- standard deviation of `ladder_score` 

--

`https://suzan.rbind.io/2018/02/dplyr-tutorial-3/`  
--

.panelset[
```{r panelset = TRUE}
happy %>% 
  filter(near(ladder_score, mean(ladder_score), 
              tol = sd(ladder_score)))
```
]
---
